intro: Chlamydojatropha, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Chlamydojatropha is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
